alert.note: Alert for Monroe; Northampton (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 26 at 3:25PM EDT until June 26 at 4:30PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Monroe County in northeastern Pennsylvania... Northern Northampton County in eastern Pennsylvania... * Until 430 PM EDT. * At 325 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Sun Valley to Gilbert to near Bath, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. * Locations impacted include... Mount Pocono, East Stroudsburg, Bangor, Pen Argyl, Wind Gap, Bath, Belfast, East Bangor, Stormville, Henryville, Brodheadsville, Kunkletown, Pocono Pines, Gilbert, Pocono Raceway, Delaware Water Gap, Skytop, Tannersville, Mountainhome and Alpine Mountain. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 292 and 314. Interstate 380 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 7. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
